snippet: The giant military contractor said the official, currently president, had a personal relationship with a subordinate.
abstract: Lockheed Martin's incoming chief executive Christopher E Kubasik is forced out after investigation reveals he had improper relationship with a subordinate; Kubasik was vice chairman, president and chief operating officer of company, and was to become chief executive, but investigation found he violated company ethics codes, leading the board to demand his resignation. Marillyn Hewson, longtime executive, will now become chief executive.
lead_paragraph: The giant military contractor said the official, currently president, had a personal relationship with a subordinate.

headline.main: Lockheed’s Incoming Chief Forced Out Over Ethics Violation
headline.print_headline: Lockheed Forces Out Incoming Chief After Uncovering Affair With Worker
